get.summary: Get informations about the configuration of this MAS instance

get.description:
Retrieve a list of compatibility sessions.
Note that by default, all sessions, including finished ones are returned, with the oldest first.
Use the `filter[status]` parameter to filter the sessions by their status and `page[last]` parameter to retrieve the last N sessions.

parameters.name: page[before]
parameters.description: Retrieve the items before the given ID

schema.description: Retrieve the items before the given ID

parameters.name: page[after]
parameters.description: Retrieve the items after the given ID

schema.description: Retrieve the items after the given ID

parameters.name: page[first]
parameters.description: Retrieve the first N items

schema.description: Retrieve the first N items

parameters.name: page[last]
parameters.description: Retrieve the last N items

schema.description: Retrieve the last N items

parameters.name: filter[user]
parameters.description: Retrieve the items for the given user

schema.description: Retrieve the items for the given user

parameters.name: filter[user-session]
parameters.description: Retrieve the items started from the given browser session

schema.description: Retrieve the items started from the given browser session

parameters.name: filter[status]
parameters.description:
Retrieve the items with the given status

Defaults to retrieve all sessions, including finished ones.

* `active`: Only retrieve active sessions

* `finished`: Only retrieve finished sessions

schema.description:
Retrieve the items with the given status

Defaults to retrieve all sessions, including finished ones.

* `active`: Only retrieve active sessions

* `finished`: Only retrieve finished sessions

parameters.name: filter[search]
parameters.description:
Retrieve users where the username matches contains the given string

Note that this doesn't change the ordering of the result, which are still ordered by ID.

schema.description:
Retrieve users where the username matches contains the given string

Note that this doesn't change the ordering of the result, which are still ordered by ID.

parameters.name: filter[status]
parameters.description:
Retrieve the items with the given status

Defaults to retrieve all users, including locked ones.

* `active`: Only retrieve active users

* `locked`: Only retrieve locked users (includes deactivated users)

* `deactivated`: Only retrieve deactivated users

schema.description:
Retrieve the items with the given status

Defaults to retrieve all users, including locked ones.

* `active`: Only retrieve active users

* `locked`: Only retrieve locked users (includes deactivated users)

* `deactivated`: Only retrieve deactivated users

409.description: Username is reserved by the homeserver

errors.title: Username is reserved by the homeserver

post.summary: Set the password for a user

403.description: Password auth is disabled in the server configuration

get.summary: Get a user by its username (localpart)

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username (localpart) of the user to get

schema.description: The username (localpart) of the user to get

post.summary: Set whether a user can request admin
post.description: Calling this endpoint will not have any effect on existing sessions, meaning that their existing sessions will keep admin access if they were granted it.

Calling this endpoint will deactivate the user, preventing them from doing any action.
This invalidates any existing session, and will ask the homeserver to make them leave all rooms.

Calling this endpoint will reactivate a deactivated user.
This DOES NOT unlock a locked user, which is still prevented from doing any action until it is explicitly unlocked.

Calling this endpoint will lock the user, preventing them from doing any action.
This DOES NOT invalidate any existing session, meaning that all their existing sessions will work again as soon as they get unlocked.

Calling this endpoint will lift restrictions on user actions that had imposed by locking.
This DOES NOT reactivate a deactivated user, which will remain unavailable until it is explicitly reactivated.

post.summary: Create a new user registration token

201.description: A new user registration token was created

errors.title: Registration token with ID 00000000000000000000000000 not found

put.description: Update properties of a user registration token such as expiration and usage limit. To set a field to null (removing the limit/expiration), include the field with a null value. To leave a field unchanged, omit it from the request body.

errors.title: Registration token with ID 00000000000000000000000000 not found

post.description: Calling this endpoint will revoke the user registration token, preventing it from being used for new registrations.

errors.title: Registration token with ID 00000000000000000000000000 is already revoked
Registration token with ID 00000000000000000000000000 not found

post.description: Calling this endpoint will unrevoke a previously revoked user registration token, allowing it to be used for registrations again (subject to its usage limits and expiration).

errors.title: Registration token with ID 00000000000000000000000000 is not revoked
Registration token with ID 00000000000000000000000000 not found

scopes.urn:mas:admin: Grant access to the admin API
Grant access to the admin API

token.description: An access token with access to the admin API

server_name.description: The Matrix server name for which this instance is configured

registration_token_required.description: Whether registration tokens are required for password registrations.

email_change_allowed.description: Whether users can change their email.

displayname_change_allowed.description: Whether users can change their display name.

password_change_allowed.description: Whether users can change their password.

account_recovery_allowed.description: Whether users can recover their account via email.

account_deactivation_allowed.description: Whether users can delete their own account.

captcha_enabled.description: Whether CAPTCHA during registration is enabled.

minimum_password_complexity.description: Minimum password complexity, between 0 and 4. This is a score from zxcvbn.

PaginatedResponse_for_CompatSession.description: A top-level response with a page of resources

SingleResource_for_CompatSession.description: A single resource, with its type, ID, attributes and related links

CompatSession.description: A compatibility session for legacy clients

user_id.description: The ID of the user that owns this session

device_id.description: The Matrix device ID of this session

user_session_id.description: The ID of the user session that started this session, if any

redirect_uri.description: The redirect URI used to login in the client, if it was an SSO login

created_at.description: The time this session was created

user_agent.description: The user agent string that started this session, if any

last_active_at.description: The time this session was last active

last_active_ip.description: The last IP address recorded for this session

finished_at.description: The time this session was finished

self.description: The canonical link to the current resource
The canonical link to the current page

first.description: The link to the first page of results

last.description: The link to the last page of results

next.description:
The link to the next page of results

Only present if there is a next page

prev.description:
The link to the previous page of results

Only present if there is a previous page

title.description: A human-readable title for the error

filter[admin].description: Retrieve users with (or without) the `admin` flag set

filter[legacy-guest].description: Retrieve users with (or without) the `legacy_guest` flag set

filter[search].description:
Retrieve users where the username matches contains the given string

Note that this doesn't change the ordering of the result, which are still ordered by ID.

filter[status].description:
Retrieve the items with the given status

Defaults to retrieve all users, including locked ones.

* `active`: Only retrieve active users

* `locked`: Only retrieve locked users (includes deactivated users)

PaginatedResponse_for_User.description: A top-level response with a page of resources

SingleResource_for_User.description: A single resource, with its type, ID, attributes and related links

locked_at.description: When the user was locked. If null, the user is not locked.

deactivated_at.description: When the user was deactivated. If null, the user is not deactivated.

admin.description: Whether the user can request admin privileges.

legacy_guest.description: Whether the user was a guest before migrating to MAS,

username.description: The username of the user to add.

skip_homeserver_check.description:
Skip checking with the homeserver whether the username is available.

Use this with caution! The main reason to use this, is when a user used by an application service needs to exist in MAS to craft special tokens (like with admin access) for them

SingleResponse_for_User.description: A top-level response with a single resource

password.description: The password to set for the user

username.description: The username (localpart) of the user to get

admin.description: Whether the user can request admin privileges.

skip_erase.description: Whether to skip requesting the homeserver to GDPR-erase the user upon deactivation.

filter[used].description: Retrieve tokens that have (or have not) been used at least once

filter[revoked].description: Retrieve tokens that are (or are not) revoked

filter[expired].description: Retrieve tokens that are (or are not) expired

filter[valid].description:
Retrieve tokens that are (or are not) valid

Valid means that the token has not expired, is not revoked, and has not reached its usage limit.

PaginatedResponse_for_UserRegistrationTo.description: A top-level response with a page of resources

SingleResource_for_UserRegistrationToken.description: A single resource, with its type, ID, attributes and related links

usage_limit.description: Maximum number of times this token can be used

times_used.description: Number of times this token has been used

last_used_at.description: When the token was last used. If null, the token has never been used.

expires_at.description: When the token expires. If null, the token never expires.

revoked_at.description: When the token was revoked. If null, the token is not revoked.

token.description: The token string. If not provided, a random token will be generated.

usage_limit.description: Maximum number of times this token can be used. If not provided, the token can be used an unlimited number of times.

expires_at.description: When the token expires. If not provided, the token never expires.

SingleResponse_for_UserRegistrationToken.description: A top-level response with a single resource

expires_at.description: New expiration date for the token, or null to remove expiration

usage_limit.description: New usage limit for the token, or null to remove the limit

filter[provider].description: Retrieve the items for the given provider

filter[subject].description: Retrieve the items with the given subject

SingleResource_for_UpstreamOAuthLink.description: A single resource, with its type, ID, attributes and related links

subject.description: The subject of the upstream account, unique per provider

user_id.description: The ID of the user who owns this link, if any

human_account_name.description: A human-readable name of the upstream account

user_id.description: The ID of the user to which the link should be added.

provider_id.description: The ID of the upstream provider to which the link is for.

subject.description: The subject (sub) claim of the user on the provider.

SingleResponse_for_UpstreamOAuthLink.description: A top-level response with a single resource

filter[enabled].description: Retrieve providers that are (or are not) enabled

PaginatedResponse_for_UpstreamOAuthProvi.description: A top-level response with a page of resources

SingleResource_for_UpstreamOAuthProvider.description: A single resource, with its type, ID, attributes and related links

issuer.description: The OIDC issuer of the provider

human_name.description: A human-readable name for the provider

disabled_at.description: When the provider was disabled. If null, the provider is enabled.
